intro: Machaeranthera incana, commonly known as the hoary bluestem, is a flowering plant native to the central and eastern regions of North America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in prairies and open woodlands, preferring well-drained soils and full sunlight. Its leaves are covered in fine white hairs, giving the plant a silvery appearance, and its flowers are small, blue to purple, and arranged in a flat-topped cluster. Machaeranthera incana is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its adaptability and role in supporting local wildlife.
